benchmark_details.name: MULTI CONIR
benchmark_details.overview: MULTI CONIR is a benchmark specifically designed to evaluate retrieval and reranking models under nuanced multi-condition query scenarios across five diverse domains.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To rigorously evaluate information retrieval models in realistic multi-condition scenarios.
purpose_and_intended_users.limitations: The dataset relies on automated query generation, which may introduce biases in condition representation.

data.source: Constructed from publicly available sources across five domains.
data.size: Approximately 2,500 multi-condition queries with corresponding documents.
data.annotation: Queries and hard negatives were created using structured prompts with LLM-assisted modifications.

methodology.calculation: Win Rate is calculated as the proportion of pairwise comparisons where a candidate that fulfills more conditions ranks above one that fulfills fewer.
methodology.interpretation: Higher Win Rate indicates better performance in distinguishing documents based on the number of satisfied conditions.
methodology.validation: Models were evaluated against both LLM-generated and human-annotated queries.

targeted_risks.harm: Potential biases in automated query generation affecting retrieval effectiveness.

ethical_and_legal_considerations.privacy_and_anonymity: The dataset does not contain sensitive or personally identifiable information.
ethical_and_legal_considerations.data_licensing: Publicly available datasets, no specific restrictions stated.
